column4: I'm using Google Chrome in Natty and I have problems with Java on some sites. I'm using the current Java 6-26 version. Any idea what I can do?
Have you tried Chromium?
wait one and I'll try it
OK, I just installed and tried to use Chromium with Java. Nope.
Forgot that Chrome and Chromium are pretty much the same thing.
What's frustrating is that when I do the Java version test on the Java website, it says that I'm up to date.
You might be best asking in the "chromium-support" channel
Does that still hold true since it's now proven to be an issue in Chrome, Chromium and Firefox?
Are you using IceTea, or Sun java?
Sun Java
Try IceTea
I ditched IceTea in 10.10 because the updates lagged behind the real world so badly.
I would stil recommend trying IceTea.
Should I uninstall Sun Java first?
yes, so you will be sure it's not getting in the way (like removing Flash prior to trying Lightspark/Gnash)
Will do!
What is your video card?
Sorry for the delay. Integrated graphics card.
Fact. Sorry, I'm a bit sleepy.
'S OK, I'm always slow...  ;-)
In this case I would even more strongly recommend trinx Xorg-edgers and Drm-next Intel kernel: http://kernel.ubuntu.com/~kernel-ppa/mainline/
OK, that was absolutely greek to me.
